author: Dr. David H. Farrar

resources.description: This table assesses number of students at UBC by visa status and thus head-counting the number of international students. In 2012W, there are 8,440 international students registered at Vancouver representing 17% of the total student enrolment. International student enrolment in graduate programs increased by 6% over the last five years while international enrolment in undergraduate direct entry degree programs increased by 3%.
resources.name: UBC Vancouver, Headcount Enrollment by Visa Status

resources.description: This table assesses international enrolment by citizenship region at Vancouver campus and the change over the years from 2006 to 2012. In 2006, students from the United States represented 20% of the international student body at Vancouver, followed by East Asia at 19% and China at 18%. For the current 2012 session, students from China now represent 24% of the international student body followed by students from the United States at 16%.
resources.name: UBC Vancouver, International Enrollment by Citizenship Region at Nov 1 [2012]

resources.description: This table assesses international enrolment by citizenship region at Vancouver campus and the change over the years from 2006 to 2012. resources.description: The report from which these tables were scraped, detailing the enrolment planning and management for UBC Vancouver campus for the year 2012/2013.
resources.name: UBC Annual Report on Enrolment, 2012/13 Vancouver Campus

name: international-enrolment-based-on-annual-enrolment-report-at-ubc-reporting-year-2012
notes:
This UBC Vancouver Annual Enrolment Report provides information on 2012-13 enrollments in programs across the campus; comparing actual enrolment to planned targets as well as provides information on enrolment projections for the next three years (2013-14 to 2015-16). These enrollment projections form the basis for UBC Vancouver’s long term budget planning. 

International enrolment continues to show strong growth at the Vancouver campus. International students registered in 2012 at Vancouver, were drawn from 154 countries. The student bodies at UBC, who work for the welfare and overall development of international students at UBC, can benefit from the two data-sets provided in this section. 

•	Student groups such as ones working for specific ethnicity group can review these data-sets and assess the number of related ethnic students enrolled in the present year as well as get an estimate of the number for the coming years. 

•	Students can also take the initiative to can develop new student groups based on the data in this report if the percentage of a specific international student group rises.
